rental_terms_full_content:
1. Booking and Payment
1.1. Booking Process
To book the caravan, please contact us via the contact form on the website or by phone. We will confirm availability and send you a booking confirmation. The booking is considered valid after the deposit has been received in our bank account and the confirmation has been issued.

1.2. Payment Terms and Methods
We accept bank transfers and cash payments. The deposit must be paid 14 days before the rental period begins. For bookings made less than 14 days in advance, the full amount must be paid at the time of booking. The deposit is considered part of the future rental fee.

1.3. Security Deposit Requirements
In addition to the rental fee, a €350 security deposit must be paid. This deposit will be refunded within 7 days after the caravan is returned, provided it is returned in good condition and all terms have been met.

1.4. Cancellation Policy
If cancelled more than 30 days before the rental period, the deposit will be fully refunded.
If cancelled 15–30 days before the rental period, 50% of the deposit will be retained.
If cancelled less than 15 days before the rental period, the deposit will not be refunded.

2. Pick-up and Return
2.1. Location
You will pick up and return the caravan at our location in Tartu, South Estonia. The exact address will be provided upon confirmation of your booking.

2.2. Times
Pick-up time is typically from 9:00 AM on the first day of the rental period. Return time is by 5:00 PM on the last day of the rental period. Alternative times may be possible by arrangement and subject to availability.

2.3. Condition Check Procedures
A joint inspection of the caravan will take place at pick-up and return. Existing damages will be noted. The renter is responsible for any new damages discovered upon return and for the cleanliness of the caravan.

2.4. Late Return Penalties
A penalty of €50 per hour or part thereof will apply for late returns, unless a later return time has been agreed in advance.

3. Usage Rules
3.1. Permitted Uses
The caravan may only be used for leisure and holiday trips. It must be used safely and responsibly.

3.2. Prohibited Activities
Prohibited activities include, but are not limited to:
i) smoking in the caravan,
ii) transporting illegal substances,
iii) using the caravan for commercial purposes without prior written consent,
iv) exceeding the maximum occupancy,
v) walking around in the caravan with outdoor footwear,
vi) damaging or deliberately soiling the caravan,
vii) being inside the caravan while it is in motion.

3.3. Geographical Restrictions
The caravan may be used in Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania. Travel to other countries requires prior written permission and may incur additional costs.

3.4. Maximum Occupancy
The maximum occupancy of the caravan is 5 people according to its design and safety requirements.

4. Renter's Responsibilities
4.1. Cleaning Requirements
The renter is responsible for returning the caravan in a clean and orderly condition both inside and out. This includes emptying the toilet cassette and waste water tank. A cleaning fee of €80 will apply if the caravan is returned uncleaned.

4.2. Damage Liability
The renter is liable for damage to the caravan or its furnishings or loss of equipment that occurs during the rental period, up to the amount of the security deposit. It is assumed that damage to a lamp costs €50/lamp, a blind €75, a window €300, and a tap €125. For damages exceeding the security deposit, the renter is liable for the full cost of repair or replacement.

4.3. Required Documents
The primary driver must be at least 25 years old and hold a valid Category B driver's license for at least 3 years. A copy of the driver's license and ID card/passport will be required at pick-up.

5. Owner's Responsibilities
5.1. Maintenance Guarantee
We ensure that the caravan is roadworthy and well-maintained at the start of the rental period. All equipment is in working order.

6. Miscellaneous
6.1. Pet Policy
Well-behaved pets are allowed only by prior arrangement and may incur an additional cleaning fee of €50. The renter is responsible for any damage caused by pets.

6.2. Smoking Policy
Smoking is strictly prohibited in the caravan. Violation of this rule will result in a penalty of €200 to cover deep cleaning costs.

6.3. Additional Fees
Additional fees may apply for optional extras (e.g., bedding, outdoor furniture), late returns, uncleaned caravan, damages, or traffic violations. A full list of potential fees is available upon request.
privacy_policy_full_content:
1. Introduction
Welcome to our website. We are committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring that your personal data is handled securely and responsibly. This privacy policy describes how we collect, use, and protect your information when you visit our website https://tartuhaagissuvila.ee or rent our caravan.
This policy applies to our website and services and explains your rights regarding your personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

2. Information We Collect
We collect minimal information to improve your experience on our website. The only personal data we actively collect and store is your preferred language setting.
Language Preference: To provide you with a smooth browsing experience in your selected language, we store your language preference (e.g., English, Estonian, Russian) in your device's localStorage. This is an essential cookie that helps our website remember your choice for future visits.
We do not collect other personally identifiable information (PII) such as your name, email address, phone number, IP address, or location data through general website browsing functionality.
If you contact us directly via email or phone to make a booking inquiry, we collect the information you provide (e.g., name, driver's license details, contact information, rental dates) solely for processing your inquiry, managing the booking, and facilitating the caravan rental. This information is handled separately from website browsing data and is subject to our booking and rental terms.

3. How We Use Your Information
The collected information (your language preference) is used only for the following purposes:
*    Personalizing Your Experience: Displaying website content in your selected language.
*    Booking and Renting the Caravan: Information submitted during booking inquiries is used for communication, processing bookings, and delivering rental services. Booking data is retained for up to 7 years after the end of the fiscal year to comply with accounting and legal obligations. Legal basis for processing: GDPR Art 6(1)(b).

4. Data Storage and Security
Language Preference: Your language setting is stored locally in your browser's localStorage. This data is not transmitted to or stored on our servers. It remains on your device until you clear your browser's cache and cookies or delete it manually.
Booking Information: Data submitted for bookings is stored securely in our internal systems with appropriate technical and organizational measures in place to protect against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction.
We are committed to ensuring the security of your information. However, please note that no method of transmission over the internet or method of electronic storage is 100% secure. Although we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your personal data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

5. Your Rights Under the GDPR
Under the GDPR, you have several rights regarding your personal data. Since we only store your language preference locally on your device via the website, these rights mainly apply to data that you may provide to us directly for booking purposes:
    * Right of access: You have the right to request copies of your personal data that we hold.
    * Right to rectification: You have the right to request that we correct any information you believe is inaccurate or complete information you believe is incomplete.
    * Right to erasure (right to be forgotten): You have the right, under certain conditions, to request that we erase your personal data.
    * Right to restrict processing: You have the right, under certain conditions, to request that we restrict the processing of your personal data.
    * Right to object to processing: You have the right, under certain conditions, to object to our processing of your personal data.
    * Right to data portability: You have the right, under certain conditions, to request that we transfer the data we have collected to another organization or directly to you.
To exercise these rights, please contact us using the contact details provided below.

6. Cookie Policy
For more detailed information about the cookies we use, especially the essential cookie related to language preference, please see our Cookie Policy.

7. Changes to This Privacy Policy
We may update this privacy policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new privacy policy on this page. We encourage you to review this privacy policy periodically for any updates. Changes to this privacy policy are effective when they are posted on this page.

8. Contact Information
If you have any questions about this privacy policy or our data protection practices, or if you wish to exercise your rights, please contact us:
By email: info@tartuhaagissuvila.ee
By phone: +372 53322495, +372 55568914
Data Controller: https://tartuhaagissuvila.ee
Last updated: 16 June 2025
cookie_policy_full_content:
1. Introduction

This Cookie Policy explains how we use cookies on our website https://tartuhaagissuvila.ee. By using our website, you agree to the use of cookies in accordance with this policy.

What are cookies? Cookies are small text files that are stored on your computer or mobile device when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work or work more efficiently, as well as to provide information to the site owners.

Types of cookies we use: We only use essential cookies on our website. These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly and cannot be turned off in our systems. They are usually set in response to actions made by you that amount to a request for services, such as setting language preferences.

2. Essential Cookies Used

Below is a list of the essential cookies used on our website:

    Name: preferredLanguage
    Purpose: To remember your selected language preference so you don't have to set it again on future visits. This allows us to automatically display the website content in your chosen language.
    Storage Method: localStorage (a type of web storage that allows websites to store data locally within the user's browser).
    Duration: This data remains in your browser's localStorage until you manually delete it (e.g., by clearing browser cache and site data). There is no expiration date set by us.

We do not use any non-essential cookies, such as for analytics, advertising, or tracking.

3. How to Manage Cookies

Since we only use an essential cookie stored via localStorage for language preference, traditional cookie consent banners are not required. However, you can still review and/or delete localStorage data if you wish.

Browser Settings: Most web browsers allow some control over cookies (including localStorage) through browser settings. These are typically found under the 'options' or 'preferences' menu of your browser. For more information about cookies, including how to see what cookies have been set and how to manage and delete them, visit www.allaboutcookies.org.

Deleting LocalStorage Data: You can delete data stored in localStorage by websites by clearing your browser's cache, browsing history, or site data. The specific steps may vary depending on your browser:

    Google Chrome: Settings > Privacy and security > Clear browsing data.
    Mozilla Firefox: Options > Privacy & Security > Cookies and Site Data > Clear Data.
    Safari: Preferences > Privacy > Manage Website Data.
    Microsoft Edge: Settings > Privacy, search, and services > Clear browsing data.

Effects of Disabling/Deleting: If you delete the preferredLanguage data from your localStorage, our website will no longer remember your language preference and you will need to select it again on your next visit. This does not affect the core functionality of the website, except for language display.

4. Changes to This Cookie Policy

We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Cookie Policy on this page. We encourage you to review this Cookie Policy periodically for any updates. Changes to this Cookie Policy take effect when they are posted on this page.

5. Contact Information

If you have any questions about this Cookie Policy, please contact us:

By email: info@tartuhaagissuvila.ee

By phone: +372 53322495

Last updated: 26 June 2025

local_attractions_intro: Discover the beauty of Estonia with our caravan. From pristine nature to historic cities, Estonia offers unforgettable experiences for travelers.
estonia_attractions_text: Estonia is rich in cultural heritage and natural beauty. Here are some must-visit destinations perfect for your caravan adventure:
estonia_attraction_1: Tallinn Old Town - A UNESCO World Heritage site with medieval architecture, cobblestone streets, and vibrant culture
estonia_attraction_2: Soomaa National Park - Known as the 'land of bogs' with unique wetland ecosystems and canoeing opportunities
estonia_attraction_3: Lahemaa National Park - Estonia's largest national park featuring coastal landscapes, forests, and manor houses
estonia_attraction_4: Pärnu - Estonia's summer capital with beautiful sandy beaches and spa resorts
nature_attractions_text: Estonia boasts some of Europe's most pristine natural environments, perfect for exploring with a caravan:
nature_attraction_1: Jägala Waterfall - Estonia's largest waterfall, especially spectacular when frozen in winter
nature_attraction_2: Kaali Meteorite Crater - A unique geological formation created by a meteorite impact thousands of years ago
nature_attraction_3: Kõrvemaa Nature Reserve - Beautiful forests, lakes, and hiking trails in central Estonia
nature_attraction_4: Matsalu National Park - One of Europe's most important wetlands and a paradise for birdwatchers
travel_routes_text: Explore Estonia at your own pace with these beautiful driving routes perfect for caravan travel:
travel_route_1: Baltic Coastal Route - Follow Estonia's northern coastline from Tallinn to Narva, enjoying seaside views and fishing villages
travel_route_2: Southern Estonia Circuit - Discover the hills, lakes, and cultural heritage of southern Estonia
travel_route_3: Islands Tour - Take your caravan on a ferry to explore Estonia's western islands of Saaremaa and Hiiumaa
camping_sites_text: Estonia offers excellent camping facilities for caravan travelers throughout the country:
camping_site_1: Vana-Veski Camping - A peaceful riverside campsite with good facilities near Otepää
camping_site_2: Peipsi Camping - Located on the shores of Lake Peipus, Estonia's largest lake
camping_site_3: Kloogaranna Camping - A beachside camping area with beautiful views of the Baltic Sea
camping_site_4: RMK Camping Sites - Network of well-maintained camping areas in Estonia's forests and national parks
faq_answer_rental_period: The minimum rental period is 2 days. This allows sufficient time to enjoy your caravan experience.
faq_answer_deposit: A security deposit of €150 is required and will be refunded within 7 days after return if the caravan is returned in good condition.
faq_answer_pricing: Rental fees vary by day: €75/day Mon-Thu, €85/day Fri-Sun, and €170/day during peak season (17-20 July 2025).
faq_answer_specifications: The Elddis Corona 490/5 sleeps 5 people, measures 7.06m total length, 2.14m width, weighs 1400kg max, and includes full kitchen, bathroom, and heating.
